title: Screen flickering- before game even starts
body:
Hey guys, 

This is the first time I'm ever making a post, usually I find the answer to my problem in some other forum but this time I can't seem to.

My problem is that whenever I try to play league of legends, my screen started to flicker like crazy. It's not my entire screen, but mainly the windows bar and my desktop. This all happens even before I'm in a game!! Due to this flickering, my whole laptop lags and I can't seem to click anything or even right click. I have to right click 10-15 times on the League of Legends icon on the windows bar to close it and after a few seconds my laptop goes back to normal. Due to the inability to click, I can't even play a game even if I wanted to ignore the flickering. This has been really annoying and I assumed it might be a patch problem but there is a new patch now and the problem is still present. The flickering seems like its just refreshing itself a lot. 

I've tried many thing from other forums including something to do with internet explorer as I thought the certificates were not being accepted, but that didn't work either :/

My Laptop specs are as such:

Windows 10
Processor: Intel Core i7-6700
RAM: 16 GB
Graphics card: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 

I CAN'T PLAY LEAGUE GUYS! ** PLEASE HELP**!!!!

replies.body:
I got the same problem during login fase, but it stops a minute or two after. BUT - during game play the game starts getting lag problems and nothing can be found anywhere.... I checked router, graphic drivers etc - even reinstalled both game and drivers, but nothing helps. 

Looks like LOL is stacking my memory ! when I open the Task Manager to find the problem causing the ping in game. Frame per second isnt dropping - only the ping goes up to astra-levels like 1200 or even higher when worst.

Seems to me the problem is LOL because other games dont cause trouble... 

But I got some similarities to u:

Windows 10
Intel Core i7 Q740
Graphic card NVidia GeForce GT 330M

I would as well like to get help... its totally unplayable after I reach lvl 6 - 9 in game... every time !!

In my experience, this kind of tearing usually happens with PC's that are just too good so I guess it's kind of a double-edged sword.  :P  To get this fixed up, go to your in-game options for some specific options:  Togle the Vsync option and select to cap your framerate.  Additionally, a recent Windows 10 update has caused some similar issues, and it's due to the auto-enabled with the [Xbox Game Bar](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) that's not working properly for some players.  Disable that to help the cause!  Hopefully, that will get you all fixed up!

Hey! 

Firstly, thanks for your reply!

I can't change the in-game settings such as the vsync and framerate because I can't even get into the game :/

I tried turning the xbox thingy off (although i never use it) through the .reg file. I tried to play League afterwards again but the same problem occurs. 

My whole laptop starts freezing and lagging, the windows bar flickers like crazy (it's still flickering as I type this because I just opened League). 

Is there anything else I can do??

Please help!
